definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out

sentences.english: Rule out neatly any words which you don't wish Jack to read.
sentences.chinese: 把你不想让杰克看的词句整整齐齐地划掉。

sentences.english: I like to dress up for work every now and then.
sentences.chinese: 我有时喜欢穿得整整齐齐地去上班。

sentences.english: After spring cleaning , all was shipshape and bristol fashion.
sentences.chinese: 春季大扫除之后一切都整整齐齐。

sentences.english: We were responsible for constantly keeping the vessel "ship-shape and Bristol fashion".
sentences.chinese: 我们负责使船只一直保持整整齐齐。

sentences.english: His books were ranked tidily on the bookshelf.
sentences.chinese: 他的书籍整整齐齐地排列在书架上。

sentences.english: His iron gray hair was precisely parted and in place.
sentences.chinese: 他铁灰色的头发在正当中分开，梳得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: He continues to carefully stack his winnings into even piles.
sentences.chinese: 他继续仔细地把赢来的钱堆放成整整齐齐的几堆。

sentences.english: These military equipments were neatly strapped up.
sentences.chinese: 这些军事装备捆得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: He never pushed the hat to one side of his head, but wore it straight.
sentences.chinese: 他从来不歪戴帽子，而是整整齐齐地戴着。

sentences.english: Why were the papers neatly stacked in the universe?
sentences.chinese: 为什么宇宙中的文件最初总是整整齐齐的？

sentences.english: I'll make you decent in a trice.
sentences.chinese: 我一会儿就可以把你打扮得整整齐齐的。

sentences.english: My mother always puts everything in apple-pie order .
sentences.chinese: 我母亲总是把所有东西都收拾得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: I get the house all shipshape while he is away.
sentences.chinese: 他出远门时，我把房子收拾得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: He placed his books in a neat stack .
sentences.chinese: 他把书整整齐齐放成一堆。

sentences.english: She ranged the goods neatly in the shop window.
sentences.chinese: 她把商品整整齐齐地排列在橱窗里。

sentences.english: The sheets were tucked in neatly, ie under the mattress.
sentences.chinese: 床单的边缘整整齐齐地掖在褥垫下面。

definition: everything clear and in good order (idiom); neat and tidy
to pile up/to stack/a pile/a stack
untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
